content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential tenant named Max Müller from Germany.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the negotiation of the rental price for my apartment in München.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you not agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: The negotiation process did not result in a mutually agreed upon price. I believed the apartment was worth more than the potential tenant, Max Müller, was willing to pay. He, on the other hand, as a student, was looking for the lowest possible rent. We tried to find a price that satisfied both of us, but we did not reach a final agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikely and 10 being very likely, how would you rate the likelihood of reaching a deal in the future? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likelihood of reaching a deal in the future as a 6. This is because we did make some progress in the negotiation process, but we still had some differences in our expectations regarding the rental price.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. The conversation was conducted in a respectful and professional manner.
name: Peter Schmidt
